00018 #ifndef __TLM_QUANTUMKEEPER_H__
00019 #define __TLM_QUANTUMKEEPER_H__
00020 
00021 namespace tlm {
00022 
00023   namespace tlm_qk_internal {
00024 
00025     //
00026     // tlm_quantumkeeper class
00027     //
00028     // The tlm_quantumkeeper class is used to keep track of the local time in an
00029     // initiator (how much it has run ahead of the SystemC time), to synchronize
00030     // with SystemC time etc.
00031     //
00032     // NOTE:
00033     // The templated class tlm::tlm_qk_internal::tlm_quantumkeeper<Dummy> is an
00034     // artifact of the implementation and not part of the core TLM standard. It
00035     // should never be used directly, instead the class tlm::tlm_quantumkeeper
00036     // should be used.
00037     //
00038     // The dummy template parameter is introduced to make it possible to
00039     // initialize the static member (mGlobalQuantum) in the headerfile. This
00040     // is only possible for template classes, otherwise the static member must
00041     // be initialized in a source file.
00042     //  
00043     template <typename Dummy>
00044     class tlm_quantumkeeper
00045     {
00046     public:
00047       //
00048       // Static setters/getters for the global quantum value.
00049       //
00050       // The global quantum is the maximum time an initiator can run ahead of
00051       // systemC time. All initiators will synchronize on timingpoints that are
00052       // multiples of the global quantum value.
00053       //
00054       static void set_global_quantum(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00055       {
00056         mGlobalQuantum = t;
00057       }
00058     
00059       static const sc_core::sc_time& get_global_quantum() 
00060       {
00061         return mGlobalQuantum;
00062       }
00063     
00064     public:
00065       tlm_quantumkeeper() :
00066         mLocalTime(sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME)
00067       {
00068         mLocalQuantum = compute_local_quantum();
00069       }
00070   
00071       virtual ~tlm_quantumkeeper() {}
00072     
00073       //
00074       // Increment the local time (the time the initiator is ahead of the
00075       // systemC time) After incrementing the local time an initiator should
00076       // check (with the need_sync method) if a sync is required.
00077       //
00078       void inc(const sc_core::sc_time& t)
00079       {
00080         mLocalTime += t;
00081       }
00082     
00083       //
00084       // Checks if a sync to systemC is required for this initiator. This will
00085       // be the case if the local time becomes greater than the local (current)
00086       // quantum value for this initiator.
00087       //
00088       bool need_sync() const
00089       {
00090         return mLocalTime >= mLocalQuantum;
00091       }
00092 
00093       //
00094       // Synchronize to systemC. This call will do a wait for the time the
00095       // initiator was running ahead of systemC time and reset the
00096       // tlm_quantumkeeper.
00097       //
00098       void sync()
00099       {
00100         sc_core::wait(mLocalTime);
00101         reset();
00102       }
00103     
00104       //
00105       // Resets the local time to SC_ZERO_TIME and computes the value of the
00106       // next local quantum. This method should be called by an initiator after
00107       // a wait because of a synchronization request by a target (TLM_SYNC,
00108       // TLM_REJECTED or TLM_SYNC_CONTINUE).
00109       //
00110       void reset()
00111       {
00112         mLocalTime = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00113         mLocalQuantum = compute_local_quantum();
00114       }
00115     
00116       //
00117       // Helper function to get the current systemC time, taken the local time
00118       // into account. The current systemC time is calculated as the time 
00119       // returned by sc_time_stamp incremeneted with the time the initiator is
00120       // running ahead.
00121       //
00122       sc_core::sc_time get_current_time() const
00123       {
00124         return sc_core::sc_time_stamp() + mLocalTime;
00125       }
00126     
00127       //
00128       // Helper functions to get the time the initiator is running ahead of
00129       // systenC (local time). This time should be passed to a target in the
00130       // nb_transport call
00131       //
00132       const sc_core::sc_time& get_local_time() const
00133       {
00134         return mLocalTime;
00135       }
00136     
00137       sc_core::sc_time& get_local_time()
00138       {
00139         return mLocalTime;
00140       }
00141     
00142     protected:
00143       //
00144       // This function will calculate the next value of the local quantum for
00145       // this initiator. All initiators will synchronize on integer multiples
00146       // of the global quantum value. The maximum value for the local quantum
00147       // will be equal to the global quantum.
00148       //
00149       // The method can be overloaded in a derived object if an initiator wants
00150       // to use another local quantum. This derived object should also take the
00151       // global quantum into account. It's local quantum should not be set to a
00152       // value that is larger than the quantum returned by the
00153       // compute_local_quantum of it's base class.
00154       //
00155       virtual sc_core::sc_time compute_local_quantum()
00156       {
00157         if (mGlobalQuantum != sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME) {
00158           const sc_dt::uint64 currentTime = sc_core::sc_time_stamp().value();
00159           const sc_dt::uint64 globalQuant = mGlobalQuantum.value();
00160           const sc_core::sc_time remainder = sc_core::sc_time(
00161                   (currentTime/globalQuant+1) * globalQuant - currentTime,
00162                   false);
00163           return remainder;
00164   
00165         } else {
00166           return sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00167         }
00168       }
00169     
00170     private:
00171       static sc_core::sc_time mGlobalQuantum;
00172     
00173     protected:
00174       sc_core::sc_time mLocalQuantum;
00175       sc_core::sc_time mLocalTime;
00176     };
00177     
00178     template <typename Dummy>
00179     sc_core::sc_time tlm_quantumkeeper<Dummy>::mGlobalQuantum = sc_core::SC_ZERO_TIME;
00180   
00181     struct tlm_dummy {};
00182 
00183   } // namespace tlm_qk_internal
00184   
00185   typedef tlm_qk_internal::tlm_quantumkeeper< tlm_qk_internal::tlm_dummy > tlm_quantumkeeper;
00186 
00187 } // namespace tlm
00188 
00189 #endif
